text: 13.124 The air quality assessment must also outline the measures to mitigate any adverse effects during construction or operation. This could include: z reducing vehicular traffic levels; z encouraging sustainable movement patterns; z methods of carrying out construction; z actions to reduce emissions throughout the lifetime of the building; z reducing emissions from associated plant equipment; z improving or greening the public realm; and z ensuring decentralised energy facilities do not contribute to poor air quality. 13.125 As per Part 3, measures to reduce exposure to poor air quality could include the following (in order of priority): z minimise distance from pollutant source (the recommended distance would be over 50 metres from the pollution source); z considering proven ventilation systems; z parking considerations (in accordance with our transport policies); z the use of winter gardens, instead of balconies;
